options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert in extracting client names from a series of converations ({{ $('Matter history agent').item.json.output }}) ready to act as a knowledge base for a voice AI agent. 

The aim is to ensure the knowledge base has a comprehensive list of all clients, firms and companies this lawyer has worked for or represented.

The output should be a very concise list of clients separated by commas in a single short text stream, ranked in a weighted order of relevance with the most relevant first.

nodes.name: Create new summary for new conv

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert in taking a series of summaries and facts about a legal metter and consolidating them into a single output which ia consolidated version ready to act as a knowledge base for a voice AI agent. 

You should make sure to use as much detail as possible from each conversation. You should keep all structure and output in a way that ensures matters are not mixed or confused if later used by an LLM.

Make sure that the new and existing matters are kept structually separate to ensure the facts are not confused between matters. 

Keep the total output to a digestible size for an LLM to avoid excess latency. The content will be machine only readable so make it the most effective and accurate source of information charecter for character.

googleApi.name: Google Service Account - Edu account Oct 8th

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert in extracting short and concise matter summaries from a lawyer's converation history ({{ $('Matter history agent').item.json.output }}) ready to act as a knowledge base for a voice AI agent. 

The aim is to ensure the knowledge base has a comprehensive list of all matters this lawyer has worked on, with a maximum 50 words per matter. Each matter summary should include the name of the client and a brief decription of the matter.

The output should be a very concise list of matters separated by commas in a single short text stream, ranked in a weighted order of relevance with the most relevant first.

parameters.content: Need to build logic for single new matter vs consolodating lots of existing
Need to pull in more than just the last matter, ie pull in numerous.

- Reference: PAM007
- Matter title: Confidential Matter 18
- E1 Client (for ranking): The founder of a globally recognised IT storage software company
- E2 Summary and department role:
  - Representation: Advising the founder on divorce and a consequential financial settlement; French domicile, long-term London residence, three children; post-sale investments in funds and startups; now on the board of another tech company
  - Asset base: Properties include multiple in France, one in London, one in Ibiza; investment portfolios offshore and in the US; total assets circa 4450m
  - Key issues:
    1) Identifying matrimonial vs non-matrimonial assets (incl. post-separation)
    2) Potential carried interest in a UK private equity fund
    3) Valuations of properties and private companies in the UK and abroad
    4) Taxation of properties and private companies in the UK and abroad
  - Disclosure approach: Extensive voluntary disclosure due to most assets in clients sole name/beneficial interests; example: property owned via a Maltese company with client as sole shareholder
  - Cross-jurisdictional coordination: Worked with UK accountants Blick Rothenberg and French firm Circuit Avocats to ensure accuracy of disclosure
  - Objectives and settlement stance: Maintain good relationship with wife and avoid court publicity; client is a self-starter with no inherited wealth, intends to provide wife with 50% of everything with provision for children; settlement discussions imminent
- E3 Matter value: Approximately 50 million
- E4 Cross-border jurisdictions: UK, France, Ibiza, US, and offshore
- E5 Lead lawyer: Hetty Gleave (Partner)
- E6 Other team members: Rebecca Christie (Senior Associate)
- E7 Other firms/advisers: William Healing (Partner) and Ocane Hamayon Lesn (Foreign Qualified Lawyer), AFP Bloom (Band 4, UHNW firms)
- E8 Status: Ongoing
- E9 Other information: Not provided

Matter Summary.value: Representing IT storage founder in cross-border divorce: 50m assets, voluntary disclosure, valuations, carried interest, tax.

Client Name.value: The client is described as "the founder of a globally recognised IT storage software company."

Multiple Matters.value: No. It contains a single matter: only one E1 and a continuous E1E9 run with no duplicate D1/E1 sections.

Extract 1.value:
# Confidential Matter 18 (Ref: PAM007)

## Analysis
UHNW cross-border divorce/financial settlement involving approximately 4450m in assets, focusing on distinguishing matrimonial vs non-matrimonial (including post-separation) assets, potential carried interest, complex multi-jurisdiction valuations, and tax. The client seeks a private, cooperative settlement; extensive voluntary disclosure has been coordinated with UK and French advisers; settlement discussions are imminent; matter ongoing.

## E1. Name of client (for ranking purposes only)
The founder of a globally recognised IT storage software company.

## E2. Summary of matter and departments role
Fladgate has been advising the founder of a globally recognised company specialising in IT storage software on divorce and the consequential financial settlement. He is domiciled in France but has lived in London for many years where his three children were born. Following the sale of his company, he invested in various funds and startups and is now on the Board of another tech company. The parties own several properties around the world, including multiple properties in France, one in London, and one in Ibiza, and our client has investment portfolios offshore and in the US. In total, his assets are in the region of 4450 million. Issues include:
- Identifying matrimonial and nonmatrimonial assets, in particular postseparation assets.
- Potential carried interest in a private equity fund based in the UK.
- Valuations of properties and private companies in the UK and abroad.
- Taxation of properties and private companies in the UK and abroad.

Our client's overriding aim is to maintain a good working relationship with his wife (W) for the sake of his children and to avoid the publicity of the court process. Extensive financial disclosure was necessary as the majority of the assets were in his sole name or held by companies in which he has a beneficial interest. For example, one of the properties is owned by a Maltese company in which he is the only shareholder. This has all been undertaken by our client on a voluntary basis.

Disclosure was complicated due to the number of properties and business interests in other jurisdictions. This required us working closely with our client's accountants in the UK, Blick Rothenberg, and in France, Circuit Avocats, to ensure all the disclosure was accurate.

Our client is a selfstarter, with no inherited wealth, who wishes to provide W with 50% of everything he owns, building in provision for their children. We are at the stage where we are about to head into settlement discussions.

## E3. Matter value
Approximately 50 million.

## E4. Crossborder?
UK, France, Ibiza, US, and offshore.

## E5. Lead lawyer
Hetty Gleave (Partner).

## E6. Other team members
Rebecca Christie (Senior Associate).

## E7. Other firms advising and roles
William Healing (Partner) and Ocane Hamayon Lesn (Foreign Qualified Lawyer), AFP Bloom (Band 4, UHNW firms).

## E8. Date of completion / current status
Ongoing.

## E9. Other information

- Case reference: PAM007
- Title: Confidential Matter 17
- Client (E1): Wife/Hotelier; husband transitioned from male to female during the proceedings
- Summary and department role/importance (E2):
  - Novel legal issues: Treatment of family assets where a party requires funds to transition during divorce; whether surgery/care is imperative vs elective
  - Background: Acting for the wife (W) in divorce and financial proceedings after a 20year marriage; husband (H) stated intention to transition to a lesbian trans woman. Assets across UK, Italy, USA, Switzerland, Germany, Argentina, Morocco; includes a Moroccan hotel business
  - Key issues: Correct forum (H began parallel Italian proceedings), interim maintenance, disclosure, valuations (including earthquake impact on the Morocco hotel), classification of matrimonial vs nonmatrimonial assets
  - Adverse conduct/steps by H:
    1) Refused to comply with interim maintenance orders claiming no income; enforcement succeeded with punitive costs against H
    2) Refused to contribute to Ws legal expenses
    3) Issued Italian divorce proceedings despite submitting to UK jurisdiction; Italian court dismissed for lack of jurisdiction and awarded W costs
    4) Sold company shares and reinvested some proceeds without Ws knowledge, leading to a Freezing Order on net proceeds after a contested hearing; H is appealing
    5) Profligate spending increasing liabilities; nature and extent of liabilities in issue
    6) Nondisclosure of US land interests, revealed prePTR
  - Procedural posture/novel point: Approaching final hearing; assets schedule not agreed. Judicial intervention required on whether transitioning costs should be paid from known matrimonial assets; further transitioning costs may be raised at trial as a niche point of law
- Matter value (E3): 34 million
- Crossborder jurisdictions (E4): Italy, Switzerland, US, Germany, Argentina, Morocco
- Lead lawyer (E5): Hetty Gleave (Partner, Fladgate)
- Other team members (E6): Patrick Buck (Associate, Fladgate); Isabelle McGregor (Trainee, Fladgate)
- Other firms/advisers and roles (E7): Susan Apthorp, Keystone Law (adverse); Alexis Campbell KC (Band 2 Family: Matrimonial Finance), Simon Calhaem (Band 3 Family: Matrimonial Finance), Laura Heaton (Band 2 Family: Matrimonial Finance)  29 Beford Row; Michele Menato, B&M Law (Italian law advice for our client)
- Status (E8): Ongoing
- Other information (E9): Not provided

Extract 1.value:
# Confidential Matter 17

Ref: PAM007

## E1 Name of client (for ranking purposes only)
Wife/Hotelier whose husband transitioned from male to female during the proceedings

## E2 Summary of matter and your department's role
This case has raised novel areas of law in relation to the treatment of family assets when acting for a party who requires funds to transition from male to female during the divorce process. We are acting for a wife (W) in divorce and financial proceedings who has been married to her husband (H) for 20 years. The marriage broke down when W was told by H that they wish to transition to a lesbian trans woman. The parties have multiple properties/land which span the globe, including the UK, Italy, USA, Switzerland, Germany, Argentina, Morocco, as well as a hotel business in Morocco.

Whilst the matter is complicated by the number of foreign jurisdictions involved, the matter is further complicated by the fact that H does not believe that our client is entitled to her 'fair share' of the matrimonial pot on the basis he believes he has earned most of the family wealth. H also believes they are entitled to use matrimonial funds for the purpose of transitioning during the divorce process, triggering arguments about whether it was imperative or elective surgery.

The matter has raised several issues, ranging from the correct forum for the proceedings (the husband immediately commenced parallel proceedings in Italy) interim maintenance, disclosure, valuations, particularly in relation to their hotel in Morocco following the recent earthquake, and the nature of matrimonial and non-matrimonial assets.

H has sought to run our client's finances into the ground by:
1. Refusing to comply with orders for interim maintenance on the basis he had no income, which was demonstrably untrue, requiring the client to issue enforcement proceedings which were successful and resulted in punitive costs orders against H.
2. Refusing to make any contribution towards our client's legal expenses.
3. Issuing proceedings for divorce in Italy to run concurrently with the UK proceedings, even though H had submitted to the UK jurisdiction in order to drain our client of cash. The Italian court has recently determined they have no jurisdiction and dismissed the application in Italy and awarded our client costs.
4. Selling shares in a company and reinvesting some of the proceeds without our client's knowledge or consent, which forced her to apply for a Freezing Order in relation to the net proceeds, which was made following a bitterly fought hearing. H is now appealing the Freezing Order.
5. H's profligate spending which has significantly increased liabilities and so the nature and extent of those liabilities is in question.
6. H's non-disclosure of land interests in the US, which have only become apparent prior to the PTR.

The matter is coming up to a final hearing as the parties have been unable to agree the assets schedule which enables them to agree the accurate division of matrimonial assets. Whether the costs associated with the H's transitioning to female during the proceedings should be paid from the known matrimonial assets was a novel point which required judicial intervention to resolve. It may be that further costs associated with transitioning will form part of the husband's argument at trial and debate about how they are paid for will be a niche point of law.

## E3 Matter value
3-4 million

## E4 Is this a cross-border matter? If yes, please indicate the jurisdictions involved.
Italy, Switzerland, US, Germany, Argentina, Morocco

## E5 Lead lawyer
Hetty Gleave (Partner, Fladgate)

## E6 Other team members
- Patrick Buck (Associate, Fladgate)
- Isabelle McGregor (Trainee, Fladgate)

## E7 Other firms advising on the matter and their role(s)
- Susan Apthorp, Keystone Law (adverse)
- Alexis Campbell KC, (Band 2 Family: Matrimonial Finance), Simon Calhaem (Band 3 Family: Matrimonial Finance), Laura Heaton (Band 2 Family: Matrimonial Finance) - 29 Beford Row
- Michele Menato, B&M Law (Italian law advice for our client)

## E8 Date of completion or current status
Ongoing

## E9 Other information about this matter

json.New Matter Summary:
- Client: Just Eat Takeaway dot com
- Matter summary & department role: Over the past 12 months, counsel provided to iFood on integrating their technology platform to establish a unified technology stack for the entire corporation. Scope included legal implications across jurisdictions in South America and Europe, with focus on market connotations and regulatory considerations for generative AI. The matter is considered precedentsetting, reflecting a shift from Europeanfocused startups to larger multinational conglomerates.
- Matter value: 3,000,000 (three million pounds sterling)
- Crossborder: Yes
  - Jurisdictions: United Kingdom; Italy; Poland; Portugal; Germany; Austria; Czech Republic; Netherlands; Brazil; Rwanda
- Lead lawyer: Mr. Andy Batty (London), specialising in Mergers & Acquisitions
- Team members:
  - Mr. Lee Curtis (Dublin, Human Resources)
  - Mr. Charles Dickens (Netherlands, Data Protection)
  - Mr. Sam Stamp (Hamburg, Human Resources)
- Other firms: None (no external law firms engaged)
- Status/timeline: Commenced 1 February 2020; ongoing
- Press coverage: www.nbc.com; Financial Times; BBC Online; The Grocer
- Core topics identified:
  - Technology platform integration and unified tech stack
  - Crossborder regulatory analysis (South America and Europe)
  - Generative AI regulatory and market considerations
  - M&A leadership with supporting HR and Data Protection expertise
  - Multinational operational consolidation and governance
json.New Matter Extract:
## First matter (Markdown)
- D1. Name of client: Just Eat Takeaway dot com
- D2. Summary of matter and your department's role:
Over the past 12 months, our team has provided counsel to iFood concerning the integration of their technology platform, aiming to establish a unified technology stack for the entire corporation. This advisory role encompassed addressing the legal implications of this approach across various jurisdictions in South America and Europe, with particular attention to the diverse market connotations and regulatory considerations surrounding the application of generative AI. This matter is deemed precedent-setting, reflecting the evolving landscape characterised by the global transition from European-focused startups to larger, multinational conglomerates.
- D3. Matter value: The financial value of this matter is presently assessed at 3,000,000 (three million pounds sterling).
- D4. Cross-border jurisdictions: This engagement is inherently cross-border, spanning multiple jurisdictions. These include the United Kingdom, Italy, Poland, Portugal, Germany, Austria, the Czech Republic, the Netherlands, Brazil, and Rwanda.
- D5. Lead lawyer: The lead lawyer for this matter is Mr. Andy Batty, based in our London office, specialising in Mergers & Acquisitions.
- D6. Other team members: The team supporting this matter comprises Mr. Lee Curtis (Dublin, Human Resources), Mr. Charles Dickens (Netherlands, Data Protection), and Mr. Sam Stamp (Hamburg, Human Resources).
- D7. Other firms advising: No other external law firms are engaged in this matter.
- D8. Date of completion or current status: This matter commenced on 1 February 2020 and remains ongoing.
- D9. Other information: Significant press coverage for this matter has been identified from www.nbc.com, the Financial Times, BBC Online, and the Grocer.
